tracks.title: Prisoner of War
tracks.lyrics:
[Chorus]
Who are you?
The depiction of an enigma
A complete stranger, but somewhat familiar
Who are you?
[Verse 1]
The scars of years gone by etched into your skin
A map of the history you’ve seen
Your eyes tired, reflect the many nights of deprivation
A window to a soul filled with trepidation
Your hair lost through the years of stress
Styled in a way that shows it best
[Chorus]
Who are you?
The depiction of an enigma
A complete stranger, but somewhat familiar
Who are you?
[Verse 2]
Your skin dry, tired, aging and blemished
A battle lost from a past you would sooner forget
(Ominous singing)A faded Polaroid paints a clearer picture
A ghostly twin from a distant era
A visual representation of failure to my own expectations 
The inevitable outcome of traumatic actions
A child covertly disguised as a man
Symptoms of a life not gone to plan
Anxiety painfully displayed in flesh
Years of running, now they collect their debt
You are my feelings of guilt and shame
You share my features and name
[Chorus]
Who are you?
The depiction of an enigma
A complete stranger, but somewhat familiar
Who are you?
[Outro]
Who are you?
If mirrors tell truth you are I, I am you
We are one split into two

tracks.title: Who are you? (Afrobeats)
tracks.lyrics:
[Chorus]
Who are you? (You)
The depiction of an enigma (who)
A complete stranger, but somewhat familiar
Who are you? (you)
[Verse 1]
The scars of years gone by etched into your skin (tzzzz)
A map of the history you’ve seen
Your eyes tired, reflect the many nights of deprivation (yawn)
A window to a soul filled with trepidation
Your hair lost through the years of stress
Styled in a way that shows it best (ching)
[Chorus]
Who are you?
The depiction of an enigma
A complete stranger, but somewhat familiar
Who are you?
[Verse 2]
Your skin dry, tired, aging and blemished
A battle lost from a past you would sooner forget
A faded Polaroid paints a clearer picture (a picture)
A ghostly twin from a distant era
A visual representation of failure to my own expectations 
The inevitable outcome of traumatic actions
A child covertly disguised as a man
Symptoms of a life not gone to plan
Anxiety painfully displayed in flesh
Years of running, now they collect their debt
You are my feelings of guilt and shame
You share my features and name
[Chorus]
Who are you?
The depiction of an enigma
A complete stranger, but somewhat familiar
Who are you?
[Outro]
Who are you?
If mirrors tell truth you are I, I am you
We are one split into two
